definition: easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes

sentences.english: The quickest and simplest way to wreck any relationship is to listen to gossip.
sentences.chinese: 关联的最快最浅易的步骤就是听信谣言。

sentences.english: They managed to make themselves under- stood using very simple English.
sentences.chinese: 他们用了很浅易的英语来设法使自己被理解。

sentences.english: It is a requirement that the senior middle school should have the ability to read some easy writings of Classical Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 具备浅易文言文的阅读能力是对高中生的一个要求。

sentences.english: This is a fairly easy book.
Printing is the most obvious of dodges .
sentences.chinese: 印刷是一种最浅易的设计。

sentences.english: This is an easy English book.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本浅易的英语书。

sentences.english: This book is rather easy for you.
sentences.chinese: 这本书对你来说过于浅易。

sentences.english: That is a fairly easy book.
sentences.chinese: 那是一本相当浅易的书。

sentences.english: This is a rather easy book.
sentences.chinese: 它是一本过于浅易的书。

sentences.english: This book is written in such easy English that beginners can understand it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是用浅易的英语写的，所以初学者可以读懂。

definition: amiable (manner)/unassuming/written in plain language/easy to take in
simple words with a profound meaning (idiom)
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
